cultureData.text: The Olmecs were the earliest known major Mesoamerican civilization. Following a progressive development in Soconusco, they occupied the tropical lowlands of the modern-day Mexican states of Veracruz and Tabasco. It has been speculated that the Olmecs derived in part from the neighboring Mokaya or Mixe–Zoque cultures.
cultureData.mediaCaption: San Lorenzo Monument 3 (also known as Colossal Head 3)

cultureData.text: Norte Chico (also known as Caral or Caral-Supe) was a complex pre-Columbian-era society that included as many as thirty major population centers in what is now the Caral region of north-central coastal Peru.
cultureData.mediaCaption: Architectural components of the complex of Áspero, Puerto Supe, Region of Lima, Peru
